ties
yelding thereto, but untill the siege of
Stenwick weare at an ende, and so I hope nowe by hir Ma
ties
former letters, and by thes present,
ey will depart from that pretext of
there staie: and therefore I praie yowe nowe proceade w

u

the Cumpanies under
S
r
Francis Veere
maie be drawen toward
Zeland
, for w
ch
purpose order is geven for shipping to be readie
abowt the xxv
th
of this moneth, But yet untill a newe warninge
be geven theie are not to be shipped, wheareof yowe shall by my
next understand a finall ende, for that the same doth depend uppon
an awnsweare that will looke howerlie to have owt of
France
:
wheareof I praie yowe so to advertize S
r
Francis Veere, and
require him to putt his Companies in as great readines as he c
a
n, both

r

m from him, as of late
yowe did send mee the musters of
Berghen
, by w
ch
yt appeared
the Bandes weare reasonablie full, not wanting in six Cumpanies
above 45 but I cannot looke for such an Accompt from S
r
Francis
Veere, considering theie have been in Action, and deminished by
sicknes, deathe, and such like: But yt shall be neadefull that
yowe doe advertise w
th
speed hether, what the defect
shall be in his
Bandes, bicawse sum order maie be geven to supplie them from here
w
ch
shall be sent to be added unto them at their arrivall at
Caen
to w
ch
place it is ment all thes supplies shall be transported./

th
send unto yowe the Copie of the Q. l
re
, the better to
informe yowe howe to deale w
th
them.
Mons
r

is to
depart from hence w
th
in thes 2 or 3 daies sent for as he saith by
the states, but to what ende I doe not knowe./ Thes my l
re
s I

r
